stanza.line: O lest the world should task you to (a)recite(/a)
What merit lived in me that you should (b)love(/b)
After my death (dear love) forget me (a)quite(/a)
For you in me can nothing worthy (b)prove(/b)
Unless you would devise some virtuous (c)lie(/c)
To do more for me than mine own (d)desert(/d)
And hang more praise upon deceased (c)I(/c)
O lest your true love may seem false in (e)this(/e)
That you for love speak well of me (f)untrue(/f)
My name be buried where my body (e)is(/e)
And live no more to shame nor me nor (f)you(/f)
For I am shamed by that which I bring (g)forth(/g)
And so should you to love things nothing (g)worth(/g)
